dt: {bc}a carnivorous medium- to large-sized bird (such as a hawk, eagle, owl, or vulture) that has a hooked beak and large sharp talons and that feeds wholly or chiefly on meat taken by hunting or on carrion {bc}{sx|bird of prey||}
{bc}a usually small-to-medium-sized predatory dinosaur (such as a velociraptor or deinonychus)

et: (sense 1) after New Latin {it}Raptores,{/it} former order name, going back to Latin, plural of {it}raptor{/it} "plunderer, robber, a beast or bird of prey," from {it}rapere{/it} "to seize and carry off, take away by force" + {it}-tor,{/it} agent suffix; (sense 2) borrowed from New Latin {it}-raptor{/it} (as in {et_link|velociraptor|velociraptor}) {ma}{mat|rapid:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a carnivorous medium- to large-sized bird (such as a hawk, eagle, owl, or vulture) that has a hooked beak and large sharp talons and that feeds wholly or chiefly on meat taken by hunting or on carrion : bird of prey
a usually small-to-medium-sized predatory dinosaur (such as a velociraptor or deinonychus)
